items.title: Awesome Angular

*   [ng-storage (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/edisonaugusthy/ng-storage) - A modern, reactive Angular service for browser storage management with AES-GCM encryption, TTL, change notifications, and Apollo-style providers.

items.title: Awesome Privacy
items.content_text:
### Self-hosted

*   [Immich (‚≠ê70k)](https://github.com/immich-app/immich) - Self-hosted photo and video backup solution directly from your mobile phone.

### Third-party

*   [Stingle Photos](https://stingle.org/) - Open source solution that provides strong security, privacy and encryption to backup your photos.

### VPNs / Alternative clients/modifications of Discord:

*   [LNVPN](https://lnvpn.net)
items.content_html:
Self-hosted

  • Immich (‚≠ê70k) - Self-hosted photo and video backup solution directly from your mobile phone.

Third-party

VPNs / Alternative clients/modifications of Discord:

items.title: Free for Dev
items.content_text:
### Education and Career Development

*   [edX](https://www.edx.org/) - Offers access to over 4,000 free online courses from 250 leading institutions, including Harvard and MIT, specializing in computer science, engineering, and data science.

### Design and UI

*   [Tailark](https://tailark.com/) - A collection of modern, responsive, pre-built UI blocks designed for marketing websites.
items.content_html:
Education and Career Development

  • edX - Offers access to over 4,000 free online courses from 250 leading institutions, including Harvard and MIT, specializing in computer science, engineering, and data science.

Design and UI

  • Tailark - A collection of modern, responsive, pre-built UI blocks designed for marketing websites.

items.title: Awesome D
items.content_text:
### Operating Systems

*   [PowerNex (‚≠ê500)](https://github.com/PowerNex/PowerNex) -  A kernel written in D
*   [SerpentOS](https://serpentos.com/) - Snek factory ([source code](https://gitlab.com/serpent-os))
*   [Trinix (‚≠ê112)](https://github.com/Rikarin/Trinix) -  Hybrid operating system for x64 PC written in D
*   [XOmB (‚≠ê349)](https://github.com/xomboverlord/xomb) - An exokernel operating system written in D

### Bare Metal/Kernel Development

*   [D Bare bones](https://wiki.osdev.org/D_Bare_Bones) - kernel hello world in D (using GDC compiler)
*   [D barebone with ldc2](https://wiki.osdev.org/D_barebone_with_ldc2) - another kernel hello world in D (using LDC compiler)
*   [XOmB bare bones](https://web.archive.org/web/20161214232759/http://wiki.xomb.org/index.php?title=XOmB_Bare_Bones) - an exokernel operating system written in D. [Main page](https://web.archive.org/web/20161201061242/http://wiki.xomb.org/index.php?title=Main_Page), [github (‚≠ê349)](https://github.com/xomboverlord/xomb/tree/unborn).
*   [Bare Metal ARM Cortex-M GDC Cross Compiler](https://wiki.dlang.org/Bare_Metal_ARM_Cortex-M_GDC_Cross_Compiler) - building a bare metal ARM Cortex-M (arm-none-eabi) GDC cross compiler for a Linux host.

### General Containers

*   [memutils (‚≠ê43)](https://github.com/etcimon/memutils) - Overhead allocators, allocator-aware containers and lifetime management for D objects
*   [dlib.container (‚≠ê223)](https://github.com/gecko0307/dlib) - generic data structures (GC-free dynamic and associative arrays and more)
*   [std.rcstring (‚≠ê9)](https://github.com/burner/std.rcstring) - A reference counted string implementation for D's build in string construct

### Web Frameworks

*   [Hprose (‚≠ê26)](https://github.com/hprose/hprose-d) - A very newbility RPC Library for D, and it support 25+ languages now.

### CLI Applications

*   [Literate (‚≠ê871)](https://github.com/zyedidia/Literate) - A literate programming tool for any language.
*   [onedrive (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/abraunegg/onedrive) - #1 Free OneDrive Client for Linux.
*   [tshare (‚≠ê135)](https://github.com/trikko/tshare) - Fast file sharing from cli, using transfer.sh.
*   [todod (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/BlackEdder/todod) - Todod is a command line based todo list manager. It also has support for shell interaction based on [linenoise (‚≠ê4k)](https://github.com/antirez/linenoise).

### Logging / Language Processing

*   [dlog (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/deavmi/dlog) - extensible logging framework with message transformation support and custom loggers and contexts
*   [std.experimenatal.logger](https://dlang.org/phobos/std_experimental_logger.html) - Phobos's upcoming standard logging facility.
*   [dlogg (‚≠ê14)](https://github.com/NCrashed/dlogg) - Logging for concurrent applications and daemons with lazy and delayed logging, [logrotate](https://linux.die.net/man/8/logrotate) support.

### Configuration / Language Processing

*   [sdlang (‚≠ê121)](https://github.com/Abscissa/SDLang-D) - An SDL (Simple Declarative Language) library for D.
*   [D:YAML (‚≠ê120)](https://github.com/dlang-community/D-YAML) - YAML parser and emitter for the D programming language.
*   [inifile-D (‚≠ê21)](https://github.com/burner/inifiled) - A compile time ini file parser and writter generator for D

### Blog Engine / Language Processing

*   [mood (‚≠ê44)](https://github.com/mihails-strasuns/mood) - simple vibe.d based blog engine

### Dependency Injection / Language Processing

*   [Poodinis (‚≠ê73)](https://github.com/mbierlee/poodinis) - A dependency injection framework for D with support for autowiring.

### Unmaintained / Language Processing

*   [dunit (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/nomad-software/dunit) - Advanced unit testing & mocking toolkit
*   [hunt (‚≠ê98)](https://github.com/huntlabs/hunt) - A refined core library for D programming language. The module has concurrency / collection / event / io / logging / text / serialize and more.
*   [hunt-time (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/huntlabs/hunt-time) - A time library and similar to Joda-time and Java.time api.
*   [hunt-validation (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/huntlabs/hunt-validation) - A data validation library for DLang based on hunt library.
*   [collie (‚≠ê61)](https://github.com/huntlabs/collie) -  An asynchronous event-driven network framework written in dlang, like netty framework in D.
*   [hunt-net (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/huntlabs/hunt-net) - High-performance network library for D programming language, event-driven asynchonous implemention(IOCP / kqueue / epoll).
*   [hunt-http (‚≠ê31)](https://github.com/huntlabs/hunt-http) - HTTP/1 and HTTP/2 protocol library for D.
*   [Hunt Framework (‚≠ê307)](https://github.com/huntlabs/hunt-framework/) - Hunt is a high-level D Programming Language Web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design. It lets you build high-performance Web applications quickly and easily.
*   [grpc (‚≠ê44)](https://github.com/huntlabs/grpc-dlang) - Grpc for D programming language, hunt-http library based.
*   [kissrpc (‚≠ê40)](https://github.com/huntlabs/kissrpc) - Fast and light, flatbuffers based rpc framework.
*   [hunt-gossip (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/huntlabs/hunt-gossip) - A Apache V2 gossip protocol implementation for D programming language.
*   [hunt-cache (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/huntlabs/hunt-cache) - D language universal cache library, using radix, redis and memcached.
*   [flatbuffers (‚≠ê10)](https://github.com/huntlabs/flatbuffers) - D Programming Language implementation of the google flatbuffers library.
*   [hunt-entity (‚≠ê58)](https://github.com/huntlabs/hunt-entity) - Hunt entity is an object-relational mapping tool for the D programming language. Referring to the design idea of JPA, support PostgreSQL / MySQL / SQLite.
*   [hunt-database (‚≠ê50)](https://github.com/huntlabs/hunt-database) - Hunt database abstraction layer for D programing language, support PostgreSQL / MySQL / SQLite.
*   [hunt-console (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/huntlabs/hunt-console) - Hunt console creation easier to create powerful command-line applications.
*   [DWT (‚≠ê140)](https://github.com/d-widget-toolkit/dwt) - A library for creating cross-platform GUI applications. GWT is a port of the Java SWT library to D. DWT was promoted as a semi-standard GUI library for D, but unfortunately didn't catch up popularity yet.
*   [LibUI (‚≠ê34)](https://github.com/Extrawurst/DerelictLibui) - Dynamic Binding for [libui (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/andlabs/libui)
items.content_html:
Operating Systems

  • PowerNex (‚≠ê500) - A kernel written in D
  • SerpentOS - Snek factory (source code)
  • Trinix (‚≠ê112) - Hybrid operating system for x64 PC written in D
  • XOmB (‚≠ê349) - An exokernel operating system written in D

Bare Metal/Kernel Development

  • D Bare bones - kernel hello world in D (using GDC compiler)
  • D barebone with ldc2 - another kernel hello world in D (using LDC compiler)
  • XOmB bare bones - an exokernel operating system written in D. Main page, github (‚≠ê349).
  • Bare Metal ARM Cortex-M GDC Cross Compiler - building a bare metal ARM Cortex-M (arm-none-eabi) GDC cross compiler for a Linux host.

General Containers

  • memutils (‚≠ê43) - Overhead allocators, allocator-aware containers and lifetime management for D objects
  • dlib.container (‚≠ê223) - generic data structures (GC-free dynamic and associative arrays and more)
  • std.rcstring (‚≠ê9) - A reference counted string implementation for D's build in string construct

Web Frameworks

  • Hprose (‚≠ê26) - A very newbility RPC Library for D, and it support 25+ languages now.

CLI Applications

  • Literate (‚≠ê871) - A literate programming tool for any language.
  • onedrive (‚≠ê11k) - #1 Free OneDrive Client for Linux.
  • tshare (‚≠ê135) - Fast file sharing from cli, using transfer.sh.
  • todod (‚≠ê16) - Todod is a command line based todo list manager. It also has support for shell interaction based on linenoise (‚≠ê4k).

Logging / Language Processing

  • dlog (‚≠ê1) - extensible logging framework with message transformation support and custom loggers and contexts
  • std.experimenatal.logger - Phobos's upcoming standard logging facility.
  • dlogg (‚≠ê14) - Logging for concurrent applications and daemons with lazy and delayed logging, logrotate support.

Configuration / Language Processing

  • sdlang (‚≠ê121) - An SDL (Simple Declarative Language) library for D.
  • D:YAML (‚≠ê120) - YAML parser and emitter for the D programming language.
  • inifile-D (‚≠ê21) - A compile time ini file parser and writter generator for D

Blog Engine / Language Processing

  • mood (‚≠ê44) - simple vibe.d based blog engine

Dependency Injection / Language Processing

  • Poodinis (‚≠ê73) - A dependency injection framework for D with support for autowiring.

Unmaintained / Language Processing

  • dunit (‚≠ê60) - Advanced unit testing & mocking toolkit
  • hunt (‚≠ê98) - A refined core library for D programming language. The module has concurrency / collection / event / io / logging / text / serialize and more.
  • hunt-time (‚≠ê2) - A time library and similar to Joda-time and Java.time api.
  • hunt-validation (‚≠ê3) - A data validation library for DLang based on hunt library.
  • collie (‚≠ê61) - An asynchronous event-driven network framework written in dlang, like netty framework in D.
  • hunt-net (‚≠ê20) - High-performance network library for D programming language, event-driven asynchonous implemention(IOCP / kqueue / epoll).
  • hunt-http (‚≠ê31) - HTTP/1 and HTTP/2 protocol library for D.
  • Hunt Framework (‚≠ê307) - Hunt is a high-level D Programming Language Web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design. It lets you build high-performance Web applications quickly and easily.
  • grpc (‚≠ê44) - Grpc for D programming language, hunt-http library based.
  • kissrpc (‚≠ê40) - Fast and light, flatbuffers based rpc framework.
  • hunt-gossip (‚≠ê0) - A Apache V2 gossip protocol implementation for D programming language.
  • hunt-cache (‚≠ê6) - D language universal cache library, using radix, redis and memcached.
  • flatbuffers (‚≠ê10) - D Programming Language implementation of the google flatbuffers library.
  • hunt-entity (‚≠ê58) - Hunt entity is an object-relational mapping tool for the D programming language. Referring to the design idea of JPA, support PostgreSQL / MySQL / SQLite.
  • hunt-database (‚≠ê50) - Hunt database abstraction layer for D programing language, support PostgreSQL / MySQL / SQLite.
  • hunt-console (‚≠ê4) - Hunt console creation easier to create powerful command-line applications.
  • DWT (‚≠ê140) - A library for creating cross-platform GUI applications. GWT is a port of the Java SWT library to D. DWT was promoted as a semi-standard GUI library for D, but unfortunately didn't catch up popularity yet.
  • LibUI (‚≠ê34) - Dynamic Binding for libui (‚≠ê11k)

items.title: Awesome Osint
items.content_text:
### Live Cyber Threat Maps

*   [Bitdefender Threat Map](https://threatmap.bitdefender.com/) - Cyberthreat Real Time Map by Bitdefender.
*   [BunkerWeb Live Cyber Attack Threat Map](https://threatmap.bunkerweb.io/) - Live cyber attack blocked by BunkerWeb, the open source and next generation Web Application Firewall.
*   [Check Point Live Cyber Threat Map](https://threatmap.checkpoint.com/) - Explore the top cyber threats of 2025, including ransomware, infostealers, and cloud vulnerabilities.
*   [Cisco Talos Intelligence](https://talosintelligence.com/ebc_spam) -
*   [Fortiguard Labs](https://fortiguard.fortinet.com/threat-map) - FortiGuard Outbreak Alerts provides key information about on-going cybersecurity attack with significant ramifications affecting numerous companies, organizations and industries.
*   [HCL Threat Map](https://www.hcltech.com/hcl-threat-map) - Cyber Threat Map by HCLTech.
*   [Imperva Live Threat Map](https://www.imperva.com/cyber-threat-attack-map/) - A real-time global view of DDoS attacks, hacking attempts, and bot assaults mitigated by Imperva security services.
*   [Kaspersky Cyberthreat live Map](https://cybermap.kaspersky.com/) - Find out if you are under cyber-attack here.
*   [Radware Live Cyber Threat Map](https://livethreatmap.radware.com/) - Radware's Live Threat Map presents near real-time information about cyberattacks as they occur, based on our global threat deception network.
*   [Zscaler Global Threat Map Dashboard](https://threatlabz.zscaler.com/cloud-insights/threat-map-dashboard) - Illustrates those we've seen in the past 24 hours, consisting of threats detected by our antivirus engines, malware and advanced persistent threats.
items.content_html:
Live Cyber Threat Maps

  • Bitdefender Threat Map - Cyberthreat Real Time Map by Bitdefender.
  • BunkerWeb Live Cyber Attack Threat Map - Live cyber attack blocked by BunkerWeb, the open source and next generation Web Application Firewall.
  • Check Point Live Cyber Threat Map - Explore the top cyber threats of 2025, including ransomware, infostealers, and cloud vulnerabilities.
  • Cisco Talos Intelligence -
  • Fortiguard Labs - FortiGuard Outbreak Alerts provides key information about on-going cybersecurity attack with significant ramifications affecting numerous companies, organizations and industries.
  • HCL Threat Map - Cyber Threat Map by HCLTech.
  • Imperva Live Threat Map - A real-time global view of DDoS attacks, hacking attempts, and bot assaults mitigated by Imperva security services.
  • Kaspersky Cyberthreat live Map - Find out if you are under cyber-attack here.
  • Radware Live Cyber Threat Map - Radware's Live Threat Map presents near real-time information about cyberattacks as they occur, based on our global threat deception network.
  • Zscaler Global Threat Map Dashboard - Illustrates those we've seen in the past 24 hours, consisting of threats detected by our antivirus engines, malware and advanced persistent threats.

items.title: Awesome Lidar
items.content_text:
### Algorithms / Simultaneous localization and mapping SLAM and LIDAR-based odometry and or mapping LOAM

*   [LeGO-LOAM ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/github-black?style=flat-square\&logo=github) (‚≠ê2.6k)](https://github.com/RobustFieldAutonomyLab/LeGO-LOAM) - A lightweight and ground optimized lidar odometry and mapping (LeGO-LOAM) system for ROS compatible UGVs.
    *   [YouTube video ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/youtube-red?style=flat-square\&logo=youtube)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7uCxLUs9fwQ)
    *   ROS 2 verison on different repo: [GitHub repository ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/github-black?style=flat-square\&logo=github) (‚≠ê57)](https://github.com/eperdices/LeGO-LOAM-SR) ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/ROS-2-34aec5?style=flat-square\&logo=ros)
*   [RESPLE ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/paper-blue?style=flat-square\&logo=semanticscholar)](https://arxiv.org/pdf/2504.11580) - Recursive Spline Estimation for LiDAR-Based Odometry
    *   [GitHub repository ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/github-black?style=flat-square\&logo=github) (‚≠ê99)](https://github.com/ASIG-X/RESPLE) ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/ROS-2-34aec5?style=flat-square\&logo=ros)
    *   [YouTube video ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/youtube-red?style=flat-square\&logo=youtube)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3-xLRRT25ys)

### Related awesome / LIDAR-other-sensor calibration

*   [Awesome-LiDAR-MOS ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/github-black?style=flat-square\&logo=github) (‚≠ê36)](https://github.com/neng-wang/Awesome-LiDAR-MOS) Moving Object Segmentation
*   [Awesome-LiDAR-Visual-SLAM ![](https://img.shields.io/badge/github-black?style=flat-square\&logo=github) (‚≠ê216)](https://github.com/sjtuyinjie/awesome-LiDAR-Visual-SLAM)
items.content_html:
Algorithms / Simultaneous localization and mapping SLAM and LIDAR-based odometry and or mapping LOAM

  • LeGO-LOAM (‚≠ê2.6k) - A lightweight and ground optimized lidar odometry and mapping (LeGO-LOAM) system for ROS compatible UGVs.
    • YouTube video
    • ROS 2 verison on different repo: GitHub repository (‚≠ê57)
  • RESPLE - Recursive Spline Estimation for LiDAR-Based Odometry
    • GitHub repository (‚≠ê99)
    • YouTube video

Related awesome / LIDAR-other-sensor calibration

  • Awesome-LiDAR-MOS (‚≠ê36) Moving Object Segmentation
  • Awesome-LiDAR-Visual-SLAM (‚≠ê216)

items.title: Awesome Low Code
items.content_text:
### Platforms / Citizen Automation and Development Platform

*   [Postman Flows](https://learning.postman.com/docs/postman-flows/overview/#get-started-with-flows) -  Postman Flows low-code editor to prototype, build, and deploy API-first apps in a collaborative environment. Create flow modules that automate tasks, integrate systems, and showcase your APIs to others on your team or the entire world with the Postman API Network.
items.content_html:
Platforms / Citizen Automation and Development Platform

  • Postman Flows - Postman Flows low-code editor to prototype, build, and deploy API-first apps in a collaborative environment. Create flow modules that automate tasks, integrate systems, and showcase your APIs to others on your team or the entire world with the Postman API Network.

items.title: ALL About RSS
items.content_text:
### RSS2ARCHIVE / For Android device

*   [Karakeep (‚≠ê18k)](https://github.com/karakeep-app/karakeep)
*   [Django link archive (‚≠ê103)](https://github.com/rumca-js/Django-link-archive)

### üèóÔ∏è Tools for parsing / decoding RSS / Webpage Monitor Services with capability of monitoring RSS Feed [1264](https://t.me/s/aboutrss/1264)

*   [Crawler-Buddy (‚≠ê125)](https://github.com/rumca-js/crawler-buddy): A server that parses RSS links, and provides output as standardized JSON. Provides feeds for input links
items.content_html:
RSS2ARCHIVE / For Android device

  • Karakeep (‚≠ê18k)
  • Django link archive (‚≠ê103)

üèóÔ∏è Tools for parsing / decoding RSS / Webpage Monitor Services with capability of monitoring RSS Feed 1264

  • Crawler-Buddy (‚≠ê125): A server that parses RSS links, and provides output as standardized JSON. Provides feeds for input links
